StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: International Collaboration of Incident HIV and HCV in Injecting Cohorts (InC3)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO HEALTH SCIS CTRVETERANS AFFAIRS MED CTR SAN FRANCISCOUNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, SAN FRANCISCO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The InC3 Collaborative has been supported by the United States National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) [R01DA599901]. Research and publication content from the InC3 Collaborative is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health. Research support for the individual contributing cohorts include: The Netherlands National Institute for Public Health and the Environment to the Amsterdam Cohort Study (ACS); Baltimore Before and After Study (BBA) [NIH U19 AI088791]; BAHSTION Boston Acute HCV Study: Transmission, Immunity and Outcomes Network [NIH U19 AI066345]; Sydney HITS-c – UNSW Hepatitis C Vaccine Initiative and NHMRC Project [Grant No. 630483]; Melbourne Networks/MIX – NHMRC Project [Grants Nos. 331312 and 545891] and the Victorian Operational Infrastructure Support Programme (Department of Health, Victoria, Australia); Montreal HepCo - the Canadian Institutes of Health Research [MOP-103138 and MOP-106468]; San Francisco (UFO) [NIH/NIDA R01 DA016017]. The InC3 collaboration steering committee includes: Kimberly Page (PI and Chair, UFO STUDY); Meghan Morris and Judith Hahn (UFO STUDY); Julie Bruneau and Naglaa Shoukry (HEPCO); Andrea L. Cox (BBAASH); Gregory J. Dore and Jason Grebely (ATAHC); Margaret Hellard and Paul Dietze (SuperMix); Georg Lauer and Arthur Y Kim; Andrew R. Lloyd (HITS-p); Lisa Maher (HITS-c and HCVC); and Maria Prins (ACS). We also ackowledge the strong partnerships and collaborations with Alain Litwin, Ali Mirzazadeh, Fabio Luciani, Fares Qeadan, George Kamkamidze, Jennifer R. Havens, Peter Vickerman and Rowena Bull. More detailed informatin about InC3 is available at: https://www.inc3study.org/ Dr. Page and the InC3 Colalborative request that publications resulting from these data cite their original publication: Grebely J, Morris M, Rice TM, Bruneau J, Cox AL, Kim AY, McGovern BH, Shoukry NH, Lauer G, Maher L, Lloyd AR, Hellard M, Prins M, Dore GJ and Page K, on behalf of the InC3 Study Group. Cohort Profile: The International Collaboration of Incident HIV and Hepatitis C in Injecting Cohorts (InC3) Study. International Journal of Epidemiology 2013; 42(6):1649-59.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
